title: Ticket #7848: DaemonCore argument parser should be more explicit with -dynamic flag
description:
DaemonCore's argument parser is designed to look for certain command-line arguments specific to DC functionality, and hijack them from the calling executable.

However its matching logic is overly aggressive; in many cases it hijacks arguments not meant for it. One such argument is -dynamic. DaemonCore's parser only looks at the first letter. If it sees a lower-case 'd', it assumes this refers to the -dynamic argument, processes and removes it from the argument list. This means that any condor daemon calling an argument that begins with a lower-case d (ie. -dagfile, -dosomethinguseful, -dontprocessthis) will get hijacked.

We should fix this so DaemonCore only looks for an exact match with -d or -dynamic. Any other argument beginning with a lower-case 'd' (or upper-case 'D') gets ignored and passed on to the calling executable.

As an aside, DaemonCore exhibits the same over-aggressive parsing for many letters besides d. We should generally fix all of these. I may later expand on this ticket (or create a new one) to deal with the other letters.
